intro: Eremogone juncea var. juncea, commonly known as the slender sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, tubular flowers that typically range in color from white to pale pink. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It is often found in sandy or gravelly habitats, such as dunes, plains, and rocky slopes. Due to its hardy nature, it is considered an important species for stabilizing soil in disturbed environments.
